examples: But originality, as it is one of the highest, is also one of the rarest, of merits.

definition: character or conduct deserving reward, honor, or esteem, achievement
examples: … he composed a number of works of merit.

definition: the qualities or actions that constitute the basis of one's deserts
the substance of a legal case apart from matters of jurisdiction, procedure, or form
examples: The plaintiff … is entitled to have its claim decided here on its merits.

definition: individual significance or justification (see justification sense 1)
spiritual credit held to be earned by performance of righteous acts and to ensure future benefits
examples: .,. the Crusades … did serve the desire to gain spiritual merit …

definition: to be worthy of or entitled or liable to : earn
to be entitled to reward or honor
